repnme.cdata!:
Russian Federation - Greenhouse Gas
            Reduction Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The principal objectives of the
            Greenhouse Gas (GHG) Reduction Project are: 1) to assess the
            release of methane to the atmosphere and propose methods for
            its reduction; and 2) to identify and appraise projects to
            decrease CO2 emissions by increasing the efficiency of gas
            use. The work effort will include the following operational
            activities: 1) identify and evaluate potential sources of
            GHG emissions, develop reliable estimates of quantities of
            GHG emissions from associated and non-associated gas
            production, and identify appropriate equipment, measures and
            procedures to reduce these losses; 2) assess the potential
            for reducing methane leakage as well as the quantities of
            methane which are vented from pipelines, compressors and
            other equipment, the quantities of gas which are vented from
            pneumatic regulators and other control equipment, and the
            quantities of CO2 emissions; 3) identify and evaluate
            sources of fugitive methane losses from the distribution
            network, develop reliable estimates of quantities, and
            define means and procedures to successfully reduce and
            mitigate these losses; 4) identify and quantify the sources
            of GHG emissions in industrial, power generation, district
            heating installations and households and assess the
            potential for reducing emissions by improving the energy
            efficiency of equipment and technologies; and 5) based on
            these assessments, identify investment projects and changes
            in construction and operation procedures required to reduce
            GHG emissions.
